description: Numbers n such that sum of digits of n-th prime equals sum of digits of n.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
example: 131 is the 32nd prime and sum of digits of both is 5.
prog: (Haskell)a033549 n = a033549_list !! (n-1)a033549_list = filter ((== 0) . a090431) [1..]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 16 2014
author: Calculated by _Jud McCranie_
